comment.author: 74471476@N08
comment._content: probably dates from August 1912, when the "Bull Moose" convention was held at the Chicago Coliseum. . . The regular Republican Party convention, held at the Coliseum earlier in the summer, had resulted in a victory for Taft over Roosevelt, leading to a split in the party--backers of Roosevelt then held a second convention in the same venue in August, at which Roosevelt appeared and galvanized his supporters. . .
